data.name: HSBC Platinum Qantas Credit Card
data.description: Earn Qantas Points on your everyday spend to redeem for flights, hotels, shopping, gift cards and more.

features.additionalValue: You will receive credit card access with this product.

features.additionalInfo: This product is eligible for a fee-free additional card.

Earn 1.5 Qantas Points for every $1 spent on eligible purchases up to $120,000 during the first 12 months of your account. Earn 1 Qantas Point for every $1 spent on eligible purchases up to $120,000 in subsequent years.

features.additionalValue: Enjoy Domestic and International Travel Insurances with Rental Vehicle Excess Insurance in Australia, Transit Accident Insurance, Extended Warranty Insurance, and Purchase Protection Insurance. Cover for claims relating to Covid-19 may be available under selected International travel insurance benefits.

features.additionalInfo: 0% p.a. interest on balance transfers for 12 months (when requested at card application) with a 2% balance transfer fee.
Up to 55 interest-free days on purchases.
Apple Pay can be used wherever you can make contactless purchases, online, and at participating retailers in store.

features.additionalValue: Complimentary Qantas Frequent Flyer Membership, saving you $99.50.
Free membership of Frequent Values by Entertainment Publications gives you access to 4,500 exciting offers at participating stores, restaurants, hotels and family attractions when you use your card.

features.additionalInfo: Google Pay can be used wherever you can make contactless purchases, online, and at participating retailers in store.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Minimum age required to apply for this credit card.
Minimum income required to apply for this credit card.

eligibility.additionalValue: Must be employed to apply for this credit card.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must be an Australian Resident to apply for this credit card.

discounts.description: The annual fee is $299 and subject to change. However, it will be waived in the first year (i.e., the annual fee is $0 in the first year).
discounts.additionalInfo: The annual fee is $299 and subject to change. However, it will be waived in the first year (i.e., the annual fee is $0 in the first year). The annual fee will be debited for the first time on the first statement of account following the 12-month anniversary of the first debit transaction on your account, and annually thereafter. The waiver ($0 annual fee in the first year) does not apply to existing HSBC customers transferring from another HSBC credit card.

eligibility.additionalInfo: The annual fee is $299 and subject to change. However, it will be waived in the first year (i.e., the annual fee is $0 in the first year). The annual fee will be debited for the first time on the first statement of account following the 12-month anniversary of the first debit transaction on your account, and annually thereafter. The waiver ($0 annual fee in the first year) does not apply to existing HSBC customers transferring from another HSBC credit card.

fees.name: Overlimit Arrangement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when your informal request for a credit limit increase is agreed.

fees.name: Late Payment Reminder Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable on or after the day an amount is due for payment and has not been paid.

fees.name: Overseas Transaction Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when you make a transaction on your account in a currency other than Australian dollars, or you make a transaction on your account in any currency (including Australian dollars) that is processed/billed by either the merchant or its financial institution/payment processor outside of Australia.

fees.name: Cash Advance Usage Charge
fees.additionalInfo: The higher of $4 or 3.0% of the total transaction amount (including any fees and charges imposed by us or a third party to effect the transaction). The cash advance usage charge forms part of the cash advance balance.

fees.name: Balance Transfer Handling Fee
fees.additionalInfo: This will be calculated as a percentage of the balance being transferred to your HSBC credit card account. This fee will be applied at the time the balance is transferred and forms part of your outstanding balance.
